intro: Angadenia pruinosa, commonly known as the silverleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered blooms that appear in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Angadenia pruinosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
